name: A First Attempt Role Playing Game
name_original: A First Attempt Role Playing Game
description:
This is baby's first Unity project, made with the help of the "baby's first Unity RPG" tutorial series from Brackeys. 

Features:

  • Fully playable from start to finish!
  • Three levels, one of which I made all by myself!
  • Thrilling "right-click until victory" combat!
  • Very safe for work: no sound and auto-pauses when in background!
  • Mildly amusing books explaining game mechanics!
  • Proof that I can make a fully playable project!
  • DLC coming 12th of never, 20XX!

Controls:

  • Left-click to move around the world.
  • Right-click to interact with an object in the world or attack an enemy.
  • I to open the Inventory menu. Left click on an item to equip or consume it.
  • A and D to rotate camera; mouse wheel to zoom.

Known issues:

  • The player sometimes has trouble reaching stuff on top of obstacles. Try scooting around a bit and using the object again.
  • When moving from to the second map, you'll get a shield even if you didn't pick it up, and you'll lose the healing potion from map 1 if you didn't use it.
  • There's no menu, no way to pause other than giving focus to another program, and no way to quit except Alt+F4 or ⌘+Q. You get what you pay for here.
